description: mounted on green paper with black borders; portrait of frowning solider with long, flat nose and curly hair, wearing helmet with winged female caryatid on front surmounted by a bird, and a long plume, and armored breastplate with animal head on PR shoulder, holding a dagger or sword in his PR hand and the sheath in his PL hand; other soldiers behind, including solider holding a staff tied with a billowing ribbon
inscription:
Title, Signature and Inscription

LLC, in brown: [Ancond 10 (?) .17 Xmbris]
medium: Pen and brown ink on laid paper
provenance: [Colnaghi, London, 1972; sold for Â£240 to Moir]; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1972-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
signed: bottom center, in brown: [Brutus.]; LRC, in brown: [Opus Dom. Peruzzini.]
title: Lucius Brutus
